yield/3 caused/4 forced/4 fair/7 flattering(Proverbs 7:21) With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
stocks/2 correction/3 bird/4 liver dart strike hasteth(Proverbs 7:22) He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter, or as a fool to the correction of the stocks; (Proverbs 7:23) Till a dart strike through his liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not that it is for his life.
attend/4 hearken/12 words/54(Proverbs 7:24) Hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the words of my mouth.
decline/2 astray/2 paths/13 ways/23(Proverbs 7:25) Let not thine heart decline to her ways, go not astray in her paths.
wounded/3 slain/25 strong/31(Proverbs 7:26) For she hath cast down many wounded: yea, many strong men have been slain by her.
chambers/2 going/8 hell/13(Proverbs 7:27) Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
standeth/2 top/8 places/12(Proverbs 8:1) Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice? (Proverbs 8:2) She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.
crieth/4 doors/8 gates/10 entry(Proverbs 8:3) She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.
call/25 sons/39 voice/52(Proverbs 8:4) Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.
simple/10 understand/13 fools/18(Proverbs 8:5) O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.
opening/2 excellent/6 lips/24(Proverbs 8:6) Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.
abomination/11 wickedness/12 truth/17(Proverbs 8:7) For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
perverse/6 froward/9 nothing/25(Proverbs 8:8) All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.
understandeth/2 plain/7 find/14(Proverbs 8:9) They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.
rather/3 choice/5 instruction/18(Proverbs 8:10) Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.
rubies/2 compared/2 better/8 desired/15(Proverbs 8:11) For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
find/14 dwell/29 knowledge/35 prudence witty inventions(Proverbs 8:12) I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.
arrogancy/2 hate/6 froward/9(Proverbs 8:13) The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.
sound/13 strength/23 counsel/35(Proverbs 8:14) Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.
decree/3 justice/5 reign/6(Proverbs 8:15) By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.
nobles/2 judges/4 rule/8(Proverbs 8:16) By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
early/6 find/14 love/16(Proverbs 8:17) I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.
durable/2 honour/11 riches/11 righteousness/39(Proverbs 8:18) Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.
revenue/2 choice/5 fine/6(Proverbs 8:19) My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.
inherit/4 lead/6 treasures/6 substance/7 fill/7(Proverbs 8:20) I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment: (Proverbs 8:21) That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.
possessed/4 beginning/14 works/15(Proverbs 8:22) The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.
everlasting/8 beginning/14 ever/18(Proverbs 8:23) I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.
fountains/3 depths/3 water/24 brought/104 abounding(Proverbs 8:24) When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.
highest/2 hills/5 fields/5 mountains/11 settled(Proverbs 8:25) Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth: (Proverbs 8:26) While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.
depth/2 delights/2 compass/3 fountains/3 prepared/3 strengthened/3 decree/3 rejoicing/3 deep/5 habitable(Proverbs 8:27) When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth: (Proverbs 8:28) When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep: (Proverbs 8:29) When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth: (Proverbs 8:30) Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him; (Proverbs 8:31) Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.
hearken/12 blessed/19 ways/23(Proverbs 8:32) Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.
refuse/5 instruction/18 wise/41(Proverbs 8:33) Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.
posts/2 heareth/7 doors/8 watching waiting(Proverbs 8:34) Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.
findeth/3 favour/14 life/53 obtain(Proverbs 8:35) For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the LORD.
sinneth/3 hate/6 love/16 wrongeth(Proverbs 8:36) But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.
mingled/3 hewn/4 killed/9 pillars builded furnished(Proverbs 9:1) Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars: (Proverbs 9:2) She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.
highest/2 wanteth/3 mingled/3 crieth/4 maidens(Proverbs 9:3) She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city, (Proverbs 9:4) Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him, (Proverbs 9:5) Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.
forsake/8 foolish/11 live/16(Proverbs 9:6) Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.
reproveth/3 getteth/4 scorner/6 rebuketh blot(Proverbs 9:7) He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked man getteth himself a blot.
reprove/2 scorner/6 hate/6 rebuke/9(Proverbs 9:8) Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
learning/3 increase/8 teach/11 wiser(Proverbs 9:9) Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.
beginning/14 knowledge/35 understanding/38(Proverbs 9:10) The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.
multiplied/7 increased/7 years/41 life/53(Proverbs 9:11) For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.
alone/11 bear/15 wise/41 scornest(Proverbs 9:12) If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear it.
simple/10 foolish/11 knoweth/11 nothing/25 clamorous(Proverbs 9:13) A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.
sitteth/2 stolen/3 secret/3 wanteth/3 sweet/7 passengers(Proverbs 9:14) For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city, (Proverbs 9:15) To call passengers who go right on their ways: (Proverbs 9:16) Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him, (Proverbs 9:17) Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.
depths/3 knoweth/11 hell/13 guests(Proverbs 9:18) But he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
proverbs/2 heaviness/4 Solomon/7(Proverbs 10:1) The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.
delivereth/3 profit/5 treasures/6(Proverbs 10:2) Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.
substance/7 suffer/10 soul/30 famish casteth(Proverbs 10:3) The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.
dealeth/4 diligent/5 rich/8 slack(Proverbs 10:4) He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.
causeth/3 gathereth/5 summer/7 sleepeth(Proverbs 10:5) He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.
covereth/4 violence/9 just/21 blessings(Proverbs 10:6) Blessings are upon the head of the just: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
memory/2 blessed/19 just/21 rot(Proverbs 10:7) The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.
prating/2 commandments/8 fool/12(Proverbs 10:8) The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.
uprightly/4 walketh/6 known/20 perverteth(Proverbs 10:9) He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.
prating/2 winketh/2 causeth/3 eye/4(Proverbs 10:10) He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.
covereth/4 violence/9 well/28(Proverbs 10:11) The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.
stirreth/3 hatred/4 covereth/4 sins/10 strifes(Proverbs 10:12) Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.
void/5 rod/13 back/17(Proverbs 10:13) In the lips of him that hath understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
foolish/11 destruction/14 near/19(Proverbs 10:14) Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
poverty/4 wealth/5 rich/8(Proverbs 10:15) The rich man's wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.
tendeth/4 labour/5 sin/12(Proverbs 10:16) The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.
refuseth/4 keepeth/5 reproof/11 erreth(Proverbs 10:17) He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that refuseth reproof erreth.
hideth/2 uttereth/2 hatred/4 lying/9 slander(Proverbs 10:18) He that hideth hatred with lying lips, and he that uttereth a slander, is a fool.
wanteth/3 sin/12 lips/24 refraineth(Proverbs 10:19) In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.
worth/2 choice/5 tongue/21 just/21 little/21(Proverbs 10:20) The tongue of the just is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.
feed/10 die/17 fools/18(Proverbs 10:21) The lips of the righteous feed many: but fools die for want of wisdom.
blessing/5 sorrow/7 rich/8 addeth(Proverbs 10:22) The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
mischief/9 fool/12 understanding/38 sport(Proverbs 10:23) It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of understanding hath wisdom.
granted/4 desire/10 righteous/41(Proverbs 10:24) The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire of the righteous shall be granted.
passeth/2 foundation/3 whirlwind/4(Proverbs 10:25) As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wicked no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.
teeth/2 sluggard/4 smoke/7 vinegar(Proverbs 10:26) As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.
years/41 fear/45 wicked/65 prolongeth shortened(Proverbs 10:27) The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
expectation/6 perish/8 gladness/8 hope/14(Proverbs 10:28) The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.
upright/14 destruction/14 strength/23 iniquity/24 workers(Proverbs 10:29) The way of the LORD is strength to the upright: but destruction shall be to the workers of iniquity.
removed/14 righteous/41 wicked/65 inhabit(Proverbs 10:30) The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not inhabit the earth.
bringeth/7 froward/9 tongue/21 just/21 cut/21(Proverbs 10:31) The mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut out.
frowardness/3 speaketh/13 lips/24 acceptable(Proverbs 10:32) The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
weight/4 false/7 abomination/11 delight/11 balance(Proverbs 11:1) A false balance is abomination to the LORD: but a just weight is his delight.
lowly/2 pride/10 shame/14(Proverbs 11:2) When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
perverseness/3 guide/5 transgressors/6 integrity(Proverbs 11:3) The integrity of the upright shall guide them: but the perverseness of transgressors shall destroy them.
delivereth/3 profit/5 riches/11(Proverbs 11:4) Riches profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
direct/2 perfect/10 wickedness/12(Proverbs 11:5) The righteousness of the perfect shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.
transgressors/6 upright/14 deliver/20 naughtiness(Proverbs 11:6) The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them: but transgressors shall be taken in their own naughtiness.
unjust/2 dieth/2 expectation/6 perish/8 perisheth(Proverbs 11:7) When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish: and the hope of unjust men perisheth.
stead/3 trouble/14 delivered/30(Proverbs 11:8) The righteous is delivered out of trouble, and the wicked cometh in his stead.
hypocrite/2 destroyeth/2 neighbour/12 just/21(Proverbs 11:9) An hypocrite with his mouth destroyeth his neighbour: but through knowledge shall the just be delivered.
rejoiceth/4 shouting/4 goeth/6 perish/8(Proverbs 11:10) When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
blessing/5 overthrown/5 upright/14 exalted/14 mouth/56(Proverbs 11:11) By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted: but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
void/5 despiseth/8 neighbour/12 holdeth(Proverbs 11:12) He that is void of wisdom despiseth his neighbour: but a man of understanding holdeth his peace.
concealeth/2 faithful/11 matter/13 secrets talebearer revealeth(Proverbs 11:13) A talebearer revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful spirit concealeth the matter.
safety/3 counsellors/5 fall/25(Proverbs 11:14) Where no counsel is, the people fall: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.
hateth/7 stranger/10 sure/11 smart suretiship(Proverbs 11:15) He that is surety for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that hateth suretiship is sure.
retaineth/2 retain/2 gracious/5 honour/11 riches/11(Proverbs 11:16) A gracious woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.
merciful/2 troubleth/3 cruel/5(Proverbs 11:17) The merciful man doeth good to his own soul: but he that is cruel troubleth his own flesh.
deceitful/2 worketh/2 soweth/3 reward/7(Proverbs 11:18) The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but to him that soweth righteousness shall be a sure reward.
pursueth/2 tendeth/4 death/37(Proverbs 11:19) As righteousness tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil pursueth it to his own death.
froward/9 abomination/11 delight/11 upright/14(Proverbs 11:20) They that are of a froward heart are abomination to the LORD: but such as are upright in their way are his delight.
join/6 seed/16 delivered/30 unpunished(Proverbs 11:21) Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall be delivered.
discretion/6 fair/7 gold/19 swine snout jewel(Proverbs 11:22) As a jewel of gold in a swine's snout, so is a fair woman which is without discretion.
expectation/6 desire/10 wrath/14(Proverbs 11:23) The desire of the righteous is only good: but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
scattereth/2 withholdeth/2 tendeth/4 poverty/4 meet/14 increaseth(Proverbs 11:24) There is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.
liberal/3 fat/12 soul/30 watereth watered(Proverbs 11:25) The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
withholdeth/2 blessing/5 corn/8 curse/8 selleth(Proverbs 11:26) He that withholdeth corn, the people shall curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.
seeketh/4 diligently/5 mischief/9 procureth(Proverbs 11:27) He that diligently seeketh good procureth favour: but he that seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.
trusteth/2 flourish/3 branch/8(Proverbs 11:28) He that trusteth in his riches shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a branch.
troubleth/3 inherit/4 fool/12(Proverbs 11:29) He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.
souls/7 tree/11 fruit/18 winneth(Proverbs 11:30) The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life; and he that winneth souls is wise.
sinner/3 recompensed/3 much/36 righteous/41(Proverbs 11:31) Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth: much more the wicked and the sinner.
brutish/2 loveth/6 hateth/7(Proverbs 12:1) Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is brutish.
devices/4 favour/14 wicked/65 obtaineth condemn(Proverbs 12:2) A good man obtaineth favour of the LORD: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
root/7 wickedness/12 established/13(Proverbs 12:3) A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
rottenness/3 bones/8 husband/9 virtuous(Proverbs 12:4) A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.
thoughts/2 counsels/3 deceit/4(Proverbs 12:5) The thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
wait/13 upright/14 lie/19(Proverbs 12:6) The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
overthrown/5 stand/20 righteous/41(Proverbs 12:7) The wicked are overthrown, and are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
commended/2 perverse/6 despised/10(Proverbs 12:8) A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
honoureth/2 lacketh/3 better/8(Proverbs 12:9) He that is despised, and hath a servant, is better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.
beast/3 mercies/3 tender/3 regardeth/4 cruel/5(Proverbs 12:10) A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
persons/3 followeth/3 satisfied/4 void/5 tilleth(Proverbs 12:11) He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.
net/2 desireth/3 root/7 yieldeth(Proverbs 12:12) The wicked desireth the net of evil men: but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.
transgression/3 snared/4 trouble/14(Proverbs 12:13) The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.
satisfied/4 fruit/18 hands/53 rendered recompence(Proverbs 12:14) A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth: and the recompence of a man's hands shall be rendered unto him.
hearkeneth/2 fool/12 right/33(Proverbs 12:15) The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.
covereth/4 fool/12 prudent/12 shame/14 wrath/14 presently(Proverbs 12:16) A fool's wrath is presently known: but a prudent man covereth shame.
sheweth/2 deceit/4 false/7(Proverbs 12:17) He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.
health/6 speaketh/13 tongue/21 piercings(Proverbs 12:18) There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise is health.
moment/3 lying/9 established/13 lip(Proverbs 12:19) The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
imagine/2 deceit/4 counsellors/5(Proverbs 12:20) Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counsellors of peace is joy.
mischief/9 just/21 filled/23 happen(Proverbs 12:21) There shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.
deal/4 truly/4 lying/9 abomination/11 delight/11(Proverbs 12:22) Lying lips are abomination to the LORD: but they that deal truly are his delight.
concealeth/2 foolishness/5 prudent/12 proclaimeth(Proverbs 12:23) A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
tribute/2 slothful/3 diligent/5(Proverbs 12:24) The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.
heaviness/4 glad/8 maketh/16 stoop(Proverbs 12:25) Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.
excellent/6 neighbour/12 righteous/41 seduceth(Proverbs 12:26) The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.
slothful/3 diligent/5 substance/7 precious/7 roasteth hunting(Proverbs 12:27) The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
death/37 righteousness/39 life/53 pathway(Proverbs 12:28) In the way of righteousness is life; and in the pathway thereof there is no death.
scorner/6 heareth/7 rebuke/9(Proverbs 13:1) A wise son heareth his father's instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.
transgressors/6 violence/9 fruit/18(Proverbs 13:2) A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.
keepeth/5 destruction/14 lips/24 openeth wide(Proverbs 13:3) He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.
desireth/3 sluggard/4 diligent/5(Proverbs 13:4) The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.
hateth/7 lying/9 shame/14 loathsome(Proverbs 13:5) A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.
sinner/3 keepeth/5 wickedness/12 overthroweth(Proverbs 13:6) Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.
rich/8 riches/11 maketh/16(Proverbs 13:7) There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: there is that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.
ransom/2 heareth/7 rebuke/9(Proverbs 13:8) The ransom of a man's life are his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.
lamp/3 rejoiceth/4 light/27(Proverbs 13:9) The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.
contention/2 advised/2 pride/10 well/28(Proverbs 13:10) Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.
diminished/2 vanity/3 gotten/4(Proverbs 13:11) Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.
deferred/2 desire/10 tree/11(Proverbs 13:12) Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.
rewarded/3 feareth/6 despiseth/8(Proverbs 13:13) Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.
snares/3 fountain/3 depart/25 law/36(Proverbs 13:14) The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
giveth/4 transgressors/6 hard/8(Proverbs 13:15) Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors is hard.
layeth/3 dealeth/4 folly/9(Proverbs 13:16) Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open his folly.
falleth/4 health/6 messenger/7 ambassador(Proverbs 13:17) A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.
honoured/2 poverty/4 refuseth/4 regardeth/4 reproof/11(Proverbs 13:18) Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.
accomplished/2 sweet/7 desire/10(Proverbs 13:19) The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.
walketh/6 destroyed/16 fools/18 companion(Proverbs 13:20) He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.
pursueth/2 sinners/5 righteous/41 repayed(Proverbs 13:21) Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.
sinner/3 wealth/5 inheritance/9 leaveth(Proverbs 13:22) A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children's children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.
food/4 destroyed/16 poor/22 tillage(Proverbs 13:23) Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.
loveth/6 hateth/7 rod/13 spareth chasteneth betimes(Proverbs 13:24) He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.
eateth/3 soul/30 righteous/41 belly satisfying(Proverbs 13:25) The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
foolish/11 wise/41 woman/42 buildeth plucketh(Proverbs 14:1) Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
uprightness/4 feareth/6 walketh/6 perverse/6 despiseth/8(Proverbs 14:2) He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
preserve/4 pride/10 foolish/11(Proverbs 14:3) In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
crib/2 ox/6 clean/6 increase/8(Proverbs 14:4) Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
utter/2 false/7 lies/7 faithful/11(Proverbs 14:5) A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.
understandeth/2 findeth/3 seeketh/4 easy(Proverbs 14:6) A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.
presence/10 foolish/11 lips/24 perceivest(Proverbs 14:7) Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.
deceit/4 folly/9 prudent/12(Proverbs 14:8) The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.
mock/2 sin/12 favour/14(Proverbs 14:9) Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.
bitterness/3 stranger/10 knoweth/11 intermeddle(Proverbs 14:10) The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
flourish/3 overthrown/5 tabernacle/10(Proverbs 14:11) The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.
seemeth/7 end/20 ways/23(Proverbs 14:12) There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
mirth/3 heaviness/4 end/20 laughter sorrowful(Proverbs 14:13) Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
satisfied/4 filled/23 ways/23 himself/58 backslider(Proverbs 14:14) The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
looketh/2 believeth/3 going/8(Proverbs 14:15) The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
feareth/6 fool/12 wise/41 departeth rageth confident(Proverbs 14:16) A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
foolishly/2 angry/4 dealeth/4 devices/4 soon/8 hated/8(Proverbs 14:17) He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
inherit/4 folly/9 simple/10 crowned(Proverbs 14:18) The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
bow/7 gates/10 righteous/41(Proverbs 14:19) The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
friends/6 rich/8 hated/8 neighbour/12(Proverbs 14:20) The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.
sinneth/3 happy/4 despiseth/8(Proverbs 14:21) He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.
devise/3 err/6 mercy/14(Proverbs 14:22) Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
talk/2 tendeth/4 labour/5 profit/5 penury(Proverbs 14:23) In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
foolishness/5 folly/9 crown/10(Proverbs 14:24) The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.
deceitful/2 delivereth/3 true/4(Proverbs 14:25) A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.
confidence/4 refuge/6 strong/31(Proverbs 14:26) In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.
snares/3 fountain/3 depart/25 death/37(Proverbs 14:27) The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
prince/5 honour/11 destruction/14(Proverbs 14:28) In the multitude of people is the king's honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
hasty/2 exalteth/2 slow/3 folly/9(Proverbs 14:29) He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
rottenness/3 bones/8 envy/8 sound/13(Proverbs 14:30) A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.
honoureth/2 maker/4 mercy/14 oppresseth reproacheth(Proverbs 14:31) He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.
driven/5 wickedness/12 hope/14(Proverbs 14:32) The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.
fools/18 known/20 midst/38 understanding/38 resteth(Proverbs 14:33) Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.
exalteth/2 reproach/4 sin/12(Proverbs 14:34) Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.
causeth/3 shame/14 favour/14 wrath/14 toward/18(Proverbs 14:35) The king's favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
turneth/3 stir/5 grievous/6 soft(Proverbs 15:1) A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger.
poureth/2 foolishness/5 fools/18 useth aright(Proverbs 15:2) The tongue of the wise useth knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools poureth out foolishness.
beholding/5 eyes/46 evil/55 place/55(Proverbs 15:3) The eyes of the LORD are in every place, beholding the evil and the good.
perverseness/3 breach/6 tree/11 wholesome(Proverbs 15:4) A wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.
regardeth/4 despiseth/8 reproof/11(Proverbs 15:5) A fool despiseth his father's instruction: but he that regardeth reproof is prudent.
treasure/4 trouble/14 much/36 revenues(Proverbs 15:6) In the house of the righteous is much treasure: but in the revenues of the wicked is trouble.
foolish/11 lips/24 knowledge/35 disperse(Proverbs 15:7) The lips of the wise disperse knowledge: but the heart of the foolish doeth not so.
sacrifice/6 abomination/11 prayer/11 delight/11 upright/14(Proverbs 15:8) The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but the prayer of the upright is his delight.
followeth/3 loveth/6 abomination/11(Proverbs 15:9) The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the LORD: but he loveth him that followeth after righteousness.
forsaketh/2 correction/3 grievous/6(Proverbs 15:10) Correction is grievous unto him that forsaketh the way: and he that hateth reproof shall die.
reproveth/3 scorner/6 loveth/6 hearts/7(Proverbs 15:11) Hell and destruction are before the LORD: how much more then the hearts of the children of men? (Proverbs 15:12) A scorner loveth not one that reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.
merry/3 countenance/4 sorrow/7 cheerful(Proverbs 15:13) A merry heart maketh a cheerful countenance: but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
seeketh/4 foolishness/5 fools/18 feedeth(Proverbs 15:14) The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge: but the mouth of fools feedeth on foolishness.
continual/2 afflicted/3 merry/3 feast/4(Proverbs 15:15) All the days of the afflicted are evil: but he that is of a merry heart hath a continual feast.
treasure/4 better/8 trouble/14(Proverbs 15:16) Better is little with the fear of the LORD than great treasure and trouble therewith.
herbs/3 hatred/4 ox/6 stalled dinner(Proverbs 15:17) Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred therewith.
strife/2 stirreth/3 slow/3 anger/21 wrathful appeaseth(Proverbs 15:18) A wrathful man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.
hedge/2 slothful/3 plain/7(Proverbs 15:19) The way of the slothful man is as an hedge of thorns: but the way of the righteous is made plain.
glad/8 despiseth/8 foolish/11 mother/13(Proverbs 15:20) A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish man despiseth his mother.
uprightly/4 walketh/6 folly/9 destitute(Proverbs 15:21) Folly is joy to him that is destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding walketh uprightly.
purposes/2 counsellors/5 established/13 disappointed(Proverbs 15:22) Without counsel purposes are disappointed: but in the multitude of counsellors they are established.
due/3 beneath/3 season/4 above/11 answer/11(Proverbs 15:23) A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth: and a word spoken in due season, how good is it! (Proverbs 15:24) The way of life is above to the wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.
border/3 widow/4 establish/4 proud/5(Proverbs 15:25) The LORD will destroy the house of the proud: but he will establish the border of the widow.
thoughts/2 pure/4 abomination/11 pleasant/11(Proverbs 15:26) The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the LORD: but the words of the pure are pleasant words.
greedy/2 troubleth/3 gifts/5(Proverbs 15:27) He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house; but he that hateth gifts shall live.
poureth/2 answer/11 righteous/41 studieth(Proverbs 15:28) The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the mouth of the wicked poureth out evil things.
heareth/7 prayer/11 far/24(Proverbs 15:29) The LORD is far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of the righteous.
rejoiceth/4 report/6 bones/8(Proverbs 15:30) The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart: and a good report maketh the bones fat.
abideth/2 heareth/7 ear/11 reproof/11(Proverbs 15:31) The ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.
refuseth/4 getteth/4 heareth/7 despiseth/8(Proverbs 15:32) He that refuseth instruction despiseth his own soul: but he that heareth reproof getteth understanding.
humility/2 honour/11 instruction/18(Proverbs 15:33) The fear of the LORD is the instruction of wisdom; and before honour is humility.
